newsitem.title: PERU: Lima shares end down on political risk worries.
newsitem.headline: Lima shares end down on political risk worries.

text.p: Shares on the Lima stock exchange closed down Thursday as investors continued to worry about the country's political risk following a series of scandals hounding President Alberto Fujimori, brokers said.
Players were largely expected to stay on the sidelines Friday as political fears were seen dragging prices down again, they added.
Thursday, the General Index fell 1.90 percent to 2,894.1 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index dropped 1.68 percent to 2,032.9 points, according to preliminary figures.
In a total of 1,632 trades, volume was 34.0 million soles ($12.8 million), brokers said.

"The political blunders of the government have made the market jumpy," said Alberto Giha of local brokerage 4G. "Investors ... are taking the sensible route by sitting tight until President Fujimori's (July 28 State of the Nation) address."
Fujimori's popularity in the polls has fallen to its lowest point during his seven years in office as Peruvians have become increasingly hostile to his perceived authoritarian style.

Last week, media allegations of phone tapping by the secret services and the government's attempt to annul the Peruvian citizenship of an Israeli-born television station owner led to violent protests against Fujimori.
Commentators have predicted Fujimori will use the July 28 speech to announce measures aimed at stopping the slide in his popularity.
Benchmark Telefnica del Per fell 1.10 percent to 6.27 soles on volume of 1.9 million shares.
Cement company Cementos Lima suffered the biggest drop among leaders, falling 8.77 percent to 5.20 soles on low volume of 25,000 shares.
Peru's largest brewery group Unin de Cerveceras Peruanas Backus y Johnston SA closed at 2.19 soles with a 4.78 percent fall on volume of 2.2 million shares.
Miner Atacocha registered the biggest rise among leaders, climbing 1.15 percent to 2.65 soles and a volume of 250,000 shares.
